subject: Re: class cast exception
msgSnippet: Yes Mike, But I am missing something. I extracted the excluded.properties from the jar and added an entry for my HomeInterface. And placed the whole file path
messageBody:
Yes Mike,
But I am missing something.

I extracted the excluded.properties from the jar and added an entry
for my HomeInterface.
And placed the whole file path on classpath prior to junit.jar
I am running this tru a Ant Script.
So I placed it in Ant classpath also.
Still I am getting the same problem.


--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> yours_jeeva wrote:
>
> > Just to add on to the previous post:
> >
> > I also tried this:
> > Added a file exculded.properties with a try for the home interface
> > which causes the class cast exception while narrowing.
> > Now i am not sure where to place it.
> > I placed it in a folder c:/junit/util/
> > and added c:/ to my classpath before junit.jar
> > Is that right?
> > Also i tried to place the full c:/junit/util/exclded.properties
> > in the classpath before junit.jar
> > Neithier of them seem to work.
> > Am i missing something here.
> > Any help would be appreciated.
>
> The answer is available in the JUnit FAQ under the "I get a
> ClassNotFoundException when I use the LoadingTestRunner" section:
>
> http://JUnit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm
>
> Regards,
>
> Mike
>
